title: Excellent Support
body: Having been diagnosed with male breast cancer in September I was referred for a mastectomy at Airedale. Throughout the process I have received excellent care of the highest order. Every single member of staff involved at each stage has shown exceptional skill and communicated procedures very clearly and sensitively.

title: Brilliant Service
body: I Went in as i was having problem with what i thought was severe heartburn the triage saw me in 5 mins went through my symptons and advised me that it could be caused by having taken too many pain killers causing a massive build up of gastric wind so have taken the tablest as proscribed and they have been already very effective so cannot praise the staff high enough

title: Very thorough
body:
The Nurse I saw was very caring and thorough, taking my blood pressure and offering a further vaccination.
Also as my blood pressure on high side printed me a log sheet for me to complete my own readings and return.

title: Flu jab
body:
Outstanding service..........just been to have my flu jab done.........took about 60secs inc all the covid precautions 

......and my god, how can they all be so happy, can they give me that jab next time?

Thank you all

title: Flu jab
body: I’m a nervous patient. ,the lady that did my injection was kind and very gentle ,which I find all staff to be when I visit

title: Flu jab
body: Lots of people arriving for their jabs, but the surgery was well prepared with three different queues for three different nurses. Ladies to tell you where to go very well organised for the amount of people attending.

title: Flu jab
body: My husband and I both attended the surgery for flu jabs this morning. There was a very efficient appointment system in place with friendly staff at strategic points directing people. This meant that it was easy to maintain an appropriate distance from others and to have the injection and then leave the area in a matter of minutes. The staff giving the injections were reassuring and explained the change in the vaccine since I last had a flu jab some years ago, and that it would be effective from about 2 weeks time. Very much appreciated.

title: Brilliant practice
body: All staff are very polite and happy to help you the service it brilliant its easy to get to and loads of room to park

title: Brilliant organisation!
body: Went to get my flu jab today. The queue management was organised with military precision! We went speeding through, with the kind, courteous staff directing every step of the way. Not a second wasted, masses of people on site to help and guide. Well done team, you’re amazing!

title: Friendly and efficient!
body: My husband and I had our flu jabs this morning. It was a friendly and efficient, quick in/out system with no problems at all. Much appreciated as we are both still shielding. Always pleased with the service at this surgery. Thank you to all the staff and volunteers.

title: Great practice
body: My husband and myself had our flu jabs today and we were so impressed with how it had been organised

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Very good practice
body: I've been using Wickham Surgery for 8 years and the service is always friendly and efficient. I went there today for my flu shot, as did a lot other people. The whole thing was very well organized, with social distancing implemented in their usual friendly and efficient manner.

title: Flu jab
body:
Quick, efficient, easy.
The booking system worked well. 
Polite staff. Advice given as needed.
I thought that I would have been notified as I am in a high risk group and would have liked a text to encourage me to book an appointment.

title: Excellent
body: Flu jab process went like clockwork, and very fast. Well done. It took a lot longer to locate the correct screen on the NHS website, and then to submit this feedback!!

title: Great service
body: I went for a flu jab and was offered a pneumonia jab as well so I accepted, I was seen ahead of my appointment and I was extremely pleased with the service. Would definitely recommend the surgery.

title: Excellent treatment for a health problem
body: I had read dreadful things in the press about GP services being unresponsive and want to say thank you to Oxted Health Centre for their speedy and efficient service.  I phoned the surgery on 29th September and was given a same day telephone appointment. This led to a face-to-face appointment with the GP specialising in the relevant area of medicine on 7th October. The treatment I was given has led to a speedy recovery from the problem. This is so much more efficient than the pre-Covid system. Thank you to everyone. You are doing a great job in very difficult circumstances.

title: Flu vaccination
body: The service was extremely efficient. The lay out was clearly marked with members of staff on hand guiding you through. I was in and out within a couple of minutes.

title: Flu Clinic
body: Appointment on time, well organised from the time of entering and leaving the surgery, all staff pleasant. All in all efficiently organised clinic.

title: Ive never been treated so well!!
body:
I came today for my flu vaccination, It was good and really fast!
I also really enjoyed the way it was organised and the whole process.
Ive never been treated so well!!

title: Fantastic care
body: I checked in using the QR app, plenty of space to wait,  and my appointment was bang on time.  The procedure - an ultrasound scan - went smoothly and I did  even have to remove any clothes although I would  recommend wearing a separate top and trousers or skirt. The technician told me what he was looking for and took plenty of photos although I will have to wait until  see my GP to find out what needs to happen next.

title: Flu jab
body: Extremely well organised system in place. In one door, queued for a practice room to be free, quick jab, out of another door - all in about 3 minutes.

title: Great service
body: I went for my annual Flu jabber. The service was excellent. My wife and I arrived at reception we were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist who told us where to stand. The Doctor was both polite and efficient. The service is extremely well organised and we were in and out before our allotted time. Brilliant service. Thanks to everyone who provided us care today.

title: good practice
body:
We attended for our flu flu vac. It was well organised and speedy.
Thankyou!. All the staff were their usual friendly selves.

title: Bad tempered doctor
body: Attended surgery this morning for the flu jab. I Doctor administering had the needle already in her hand. She started shouting at me in front of everyone when I asked if it was clean. Normally they take it out the packet in front of you. A lot of vulnerable people in the line with me. She did stop shouting when I asked her to and then treated me like a child afterwards to make her point that she was in charge.  I took a risk and did get the jab but the whole experience was a very negative one for me. There was no compassion, reassurance or aftercare given. You cannot put a price on basic humanity.  I would not recommend this surgery.  My advice look elsewhere.

title: Excellent practice
body: Went for a flu jab and was also offered a pneumonia jab. The practice nurse was excellent and very efficient.

title: Excellent Practice
body: I had my Flu Jab this morning and was very impressed with the efficient service .It was a pleasant experience .Social distancing well organized and all the  staff very pleasant.

title: steroid injection to relieve pain in right ankle
body: My experience for this procedure was very positive. I attended the hospital after self isolating for three days after a Covid 19 test which proved negative. I arrived at the hospital at 7.40 am and returned home by 10.20 am. The surgeon and his staff and all the nursing staff and cleaners were extremely pleasant and treated me with courtesy and respect. Every part of the procedure was clearly explained to me so that I new what to expect. This made me feel at ease with everything that was carried out. I was given tea and biscuits afterwards while I waited to be picked up by my wife in the car. I was picked up from the ward door and so was able to walk out to the car. I will certainly recommend this hospital and the procedure in future for cleanliness, the pleasant staff and the timing. It all worked out perfectly.

title: The best practice I have ever experienced
body: What an efficient, friendly, safe and brilliant practice. I went for a flu jab today and the whole process, from entry to exit, took less than 5 minutes. I felt welcomed and informed and staff were friendly whilst being super efficient. Cannot fault it. Thank you everyone.

title: Flu Jabs
body: What a great team!  Super efficient system in place for flu jabs - we were in and out in less than five minutes.  Thank you all.

title: Outstanding service
body: I recently attended Dermatology. The whole experience was faultless. Staff were friendly and polite, putting you at ease. Had a procedure in the theatre, everything was well organised and the whole process was efficient. I am very grateful for the treatment I received from our NHS and would like to thank all the staff and Doctors involved in my care. The end result has been excellent, recovery was uneventful and this is testament to the care and skill of the staff team Thank you for what you do.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Phototherapy Basford
body:
I have been having appointments for the last 6 weeks. Staff have been fantastic, very professional and knowledgeable about my condition. They have given me advice and help all the way. When the treatment wasn’t working I was referred straight to the dermatologist and then referred to the hospital (awaiting an appointment) all with a week. 
I feel finally after enduring eczema all my life that finally I am getting my skin under control. This is all because of the amazing staff at the clinic in Basford. 
I was able to have the appointment times I needed because of work etc. all the way though my treatment.

title: Fantastic prompt treatment
body:
I attended the Minor Injuries Unit having had a nasty fall from my bike - and had a deep gash on my elbow and various cuts and grazes on my hand and leg.

I was seen immediately and the Nurse Practitioner who saw me was fantastic - giving me local anaesthetic and then cleaning and stitching my wounds and applying iodine dressings, all the while, taking time to reassure me and explain what he was doing.

SO impressed with the prompt treatment, expert care and the way in which I was looked after throughout my visit.

Thank you

title: Flu Jab
body:
I had my flu jab today (24 Oct) it was incredibly well organised with a plethora of guides to ensure that everything flowed smoothly and social distancing was maintained.
I was in and out in two minutes and all staf were helpful and cheerful.
Extremely well organised and conducted.  Well done all concerned.

title: Great service
body:
I have just spent a week in hospital and am please to say the whole experience was second to none.
The treatment was careing and professional. The cleaning was nonstop by all staff. The staff were pleasant and friendly at all times even when some of the patients weren’t.
The food was excellent with plenty of choice. I felt the staff went above and beyond, I was extremely well cared for.
Three and a half years ago I spent 12 days there and it was good, now it is even better.
A very big thank you to all the staff, you should all be very proud of yourselves.

title: Liverpool site
body: Thank you all x who knew I had been living in the dark life is bright X lovely service and care from whole team x

title: Excellent GP
body: I really would like to thank all the doctors  and nurses for all the help and support they gave my mum and me during her illness. They couldn't have done more. They were there anytime I needed them or if my mum needed anything. Anytime she needed to be seen they would accommodate. Also the admin staff are just as excellent as the GPs. I can not say enough praise. Thank you doesn't seem enough but it's all I can say to them all at this practice.  I would recommend this surgery to anyone as you couldn't get better service and care.

title: Always Received First Class Service
body: I had my Flu jab today and the whole experience was brilliant!  Allesley Surgery provided safety zones for both Staff and patients and a well structured procedure was clearly evident.  Well done to all of the Staff!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Fantastic care at Ward 16
body:
My Mother spent 9 weeks in Ward 16 Bishop Auckland hospital.
At all times she was treat with dignity and caring support. ALL
staff were lovely and kind, doing everything they possibly 
could for her.

Unfortunately at 93 years old , there was nothing anyone could
do to prolong her life and shortly after returning home she passed
away.

I would like to say a big thank you to every one involved in my
Mothers care, I could not have asked for any more.

title: great practice
body: had my flu and pneumonia jabs today very proffessional and efficient and informatative   i would recomend this surgery and service to friends

title: Bad attitude
body: I was admitted to your hospital on 22/10/20 with a very high temperature and seen in A&E. They took a covid swab and I was admitted to Ward 3. The next day a nurse came into my room and said she was there to take a swab. I explained that they had already took one the previous night, I was then told that they couldn't find it and I needed another one. I presume I am negative as no one told me my results. As it happens I had an infection and with being a chemo patient, They couldn't take the chance and discharge me. I was put on I V antibiotics and feel better today. I could not fault ward 3 but today I was discharged and taken to the discharge room, Where they booked transport for me. This was at 2.30, At 4.30 my transport still had not arrived and I asked a passing nurse if it had been booked. Her attitude was appalling, She said "Of course its been booked" very aggressively. There was no need for that. My transport eventually arrived and as I was leaving the same nurse followed me and said"Oh you're leaving, Bye then"very sarcastically. All the other staff had been great but this one staff member spoiled my stay. If I have to come back, I'll book a taxi to get home..

title: Fantastic
body: Thank you so much for seeing me so quickly and so kindly to all the staff and key workers and special the breast care clinic

title: Thank You
body: Thank you to all in RAA for your care and kindness last night.  All the very best, take care and keep safe.  Kindest regards.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Excellent Surgey with good service from all staff. Very professional environment and patients are dealt with Care.

title: Great service
body:
Well organised for flu jabs. Felt safe and was out in about 5 mins. 
Excellent service from Dr Barnes on another matter.

title: Great practice
body: Had our flu jab today was most impressed with the organisation,  checked in car park before going in social distancing inside and oneway system in at 8.15 home by 8.35.Have not been with this practice long but am very happy with all my treatment

title: Flu jab
body:
Just to say a big thank you for such amazing organisations, clearly signed as to where to go, quick lol up of the sleeve and on my way hope. Cheery faces apart from having to have a needle in my arm( didn’t hurt a bit) it was quite the best flu vaccination I have had.
Well done everyone and thank you.

title: Flu Vaccination
body: I have just been for my flu vaccination and the organisation and friendly staff were second to none.  No waiting and the friendly military precision was great. Thank you Westgate.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I’ve been with the practice for 20+ years. The level of care I & my family have received has been exemplary throughout this time. Even in this time of coronavirus, I have been able to easily access medical help by the  gp firstly phoning and offering advice over the phone. My last few calls resulted in the gp asking me to attend later that day for a physical examination & then arranging for urgent scans, which I received an appointment for 12 days later at local hospital.
4 days later I needed to contact the surgery regards another matter & the receptionist arranged for the doctor to phone me straight back, after listening to my concerns she was happy to see me later in day but advised me that it would be better for me to attend  a&e asap. I was seen immediately in triage at hospital & spent next several hours in resus department.
I can not fault the practice who provide excellent care from the polite & helpful receptionists, hard working nurses, health care assistants and to the many gp’s who have always listened & offered the highest level of care to myself & my family.

title: Great Hospital
body:
I had first class care, Doctors and nurses were very professional, courteous and extremely helpful.
The hospital is really clean and modern looking inside.

title: waiting in the cold for an appointment
body: I am very disappointed that patients have to wait in the cold outside, till the GP call them. This is unacceptable in this cold, rainy and windy days. The wait could take a while like any normal appointments. I am over sixties, have health issues and asthmatic too. This can be quite dangerous for people like me, in terms of  catching a cold or aggravation of an asthma attack. patients should be able to wait inside the building or in their cars and be called when GP is ready to see them. I still am suffering from an asthma attack and a cold since my last visit.

title: Excellent service
body: Attended first Saturday morning session for Flu vaccination. Very impressed with how efficient this was. Due to Covid restrictions, temperature taken, hands sanitised and booked in all done outside. Then followed directions inside. Vaccinated, then followed one way system out. The whole process only took a couple of minutes. Excellent service and felt very safe.

title: efficient and helpful practice
body: Flu vaccine administered with precision and utmost care , especially in view of Covid 19 restrictions, all carefully observed and explained.

title: Influenza Vaccine
body:
We attended Leiston Surgery for our pre-booked influenza vaccine this morning, Saturday 24/10/2020. Everything went extremely well - initial greeting and registration straightforward, no delays, nursing staff administering vaccine friendly and efficient. And we were out ahead of time. 
The whole procedure was very well organised and efficient.

title: Brill!
body: Brilliant service and excellent staff. They were all so polite and welcoming. Made up I didn't have to walk in and they are wheelchair friendly. Very clean and would definitely recommend!

title: Shout out to Throckley Primary Healthcare
body: This practice needs a shout out.  They have developed innovative working practices to maintain their high level of care during Covid-19. Every one of the healthcare team who has dealt with our family has been courteous, professional and caring. We have seen many improvements such as maintaining same day telephone appointments and introducing excellent online consultations, (my mum 87 could stay safe at home, and we hope this service will continue). The appointment system, security on entrance and one-way system within the surgery have given us reassurance.  This is a well run surgery providing excellent care to my family and in these testing times, and with a smile.  There is not one member of the practice our family would not hesitate go to for help and advice, because we know we would be in safe hands.  Thank you.

title: Splendid Practice
body:
I have always received outstanding treatment from everyone at this practice.

The receptionists and admin staff are always friendly and professional. 

The GPs, and nurse practitioners, have always been extremely supportive and helpful.

However I would suggest that lunchtime closing is displayed - especially in the information provided by Google - because it appears you are open all day!

title: Flu vaccination
body: Well planned, temperature checks at entrance, swift check in, barely waited a minute and called to one of the exam rooms. A quick explanation and offer of the pneumonia vaccine. Quickly done and away.

title: Flu vac
body: The team were exceptionally professional from booking to completion. All staff helpful and courteous.

title: Great Flu Jabs
body: A slick, informative process undertaken by happy, smiley staff. It could not have been better. A rainy Saturday morning didn't deter their spirits. Excellent service and in this time of Covid no visits touched anything within the clinic.

title: Poor service for my wife
body: My wife has been in pain suffering for a longtime. When we called she could not get through to the surgery. Finally we did to speak to her GP and we were told sorry no phone calls on the system for her preferred GP. Once we did get one after weeks of calling a referral was made and it was never sent to the right place. I understand mistakes happen but we should to spend three days on the phone trying to sort it out. As a result the stress she was under has made her illness worse.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Why can’t I see a GP?
body: I have been a patient of this practice for years but am very disappointed at the service I have received. I understand the current situation but why can I not see a G P face to face? It seems like this is how they would like it now but is no good for patients. Recently I had a sore throat, first it was you must have Covid which I knew it wasn’t but had a test in the hope I could see a doctor....which came back negative as I knew it would! So did I get to see a doctor ? No I was asked to take a picture of my tonsils and send to them then I was told to gargle with salt water! As it happens it was tonsillitis in the end. If I had of been seen by a doctor or nurse for 5 minutes I could have been diagnosed correctly. It seems no one gets to see anyone up there anymore , but you can go to a&e and see a person in the flesh sort yourself out staple medical centre you are letting your community down.

title: Terrible booking system & bring a stool to sit…
body: Very long waiting times to get through. What is the point of having a queuing system on the phone informing you of your turn when also this is not reliable. During my half an hour wait I was at some point number 2 in the queue and went was downgraded to number 3 and at some point I was number one and then suddenly I was number 2. Also, when I asked one of the doctors why they cannot fix their reception area so that people (limited capacity spaced out) can sit instead of waiting outside, standing under the rain he told me that they are waiting for partitions for the receptionists! How long could that possibly take when most shops have already put this in place? Shouldn't that be a priority so that people (who are sick obviously), some are elderly, some have back problems, can sit? Terrible.

title: The worst admin/reception ever
body: They are awful. I call at 11am and I am 20th in the queue. Each call seems to last half an hour, so I waiting on hold, literally for hours. I will then get disconnected because the surgery is closing down or they hang up when it's time for their break. They never send my prescription to my nominated pharmacy either. I don't believe that each call they are taking lasts for half an hour, they are doing something so as to not answer calls. I called now at 17:00 and started as number 10 in the queue, it's 17:32 and I am position 8. At 18:00 they will hang up and close the surgery. I was on hold for to hours this morning and now I will be on hold until 18:00. Yesterday I was on hold for 1.5 hours and got cut off when their lunch break was due. They are unprofessional and inhumane.

title: Wonderful practice
body: All the staff are professional, caring and very attentive. I can highly recommend the services that I received.

title: Amazing
body:
This is the second time that we have had to stay at the children’s ward with our young daughter. The staff here are incredible so kind and caring, compassionate, friendly and professional. They have made our stay with our 2 year old as comfortable as possible and they engage with her so well it’s been really difficult keeping her in hospital and keeping her entertained and comfortable but the staff have done an amazing job considering all the play facilities are closed due to covid. 

The only thing is I feel the ward needs upgrading from the toilets to the rooms they are kept clean however it is so hot on the ward it’s uncomfortable! I want to thank all on the children’s ward for all their hard work and dedication. You are amazing! 

Thank you!

title: Disrespectful staff
body:
There's a handwritten sign on the main entrance stating "Flu jabs" the door held wide open...don't go in there, you will be ignored by the reception after saying hello, then told off for going through there by the nurse, oh and don't think you can go into the pharmacy entrance either because that's locked!

As the receptionist who is on the payroll will ignore you, I'll tell you now, you have to go around to the fire escape in the car park (the one we all know about right?)

No cleaning before jabbing, I was told to put my stuff on the waiting room floor. I'm quite horrified at how unpleasant the whole experience was. If you have anxiety don't go alone.

title: disappointing
body: I have been with this practice for over 20 years and always found it very good. I need to email one of the doctors there but the surgery has no email address and the is no other way of contacting him, except by going via one of the receptionists during weekday working hours  to make an appointment for a telephone consultation days ahead. This really isnt good enough when you can't even get to talk to a gp, let alone actually make an appointment to see one. I am desperate to speak to my gp but it seems unless you're dying of something, we're shoved on the waiting list. And how can certain conditions be diagnosed on the phone?

title: Flu clinic
body: Very well organised. They should give the people asking questions outside the entrance a bit more room to give cars coming in space, but everything is very well set up, they have thought it through well.

title: Great practice
body: Very Efficient, i felt extremely safe in the practice ,staff where really friendly, could not be better in my view.

title: Phone consultation
body: The conversation on the phone with the GP today was great. She was kind, professional and encouraging. It was a very uplifting experience.

title: Brilliant organisation of flu jab
body:
Flu jab booked for my husband and myself. We were given specific timed slots. Arrived at surgery where members of staff were all wearing hi- vis tabards directing patients via one way system. Hand sanitiser at first internal point then directed through surgery to individual rooms. Name taken and checked, jab given - I HATE NEEDLES - but was able to sit down - all OK - then we were directed out of the surgery following the one way system.
Really excellent organisation. WELL DONE to all the staff.

title: Doctors are fine, receptionists are dreadful
body: Dealing with the receptionists at this practice is so stressful. You practically have to battle to get to the point where you are given an appointment with a doctor. When I tried to book an appointment I was repeatedly told to look online even though I kept telling them my symptoms were not on the online tool and I needed to speak to a doctor over the phone. I was then asked what I wanted to speak to the doctor about and I said I’d prefer not to go into detail and they said I had to if I wanted the appointment. I said there is no rule or NHS stipulation that I needed to do that. The receptionist then said if I wouldn’t explain the reason I would not be given an appointment to speak to a doctor and would need to use the website. The phone call and way I was treated was distressing and puts me off contacting this practice as it’s just too much hard work and stressful to get past the receptionists to access treatment

title: Top Marks for this Surgery
body: Both myself and my wife attended the annual `Flue Jab` today it was the best organized it has ever been, all the staff  from the car park to the exit where very polite and very professional, many thanks and top marks to you all.

title: Joke
body: After the “normal” hour plus to get an actual person I am offered a triage call back appointment. Date of said call back 11 days. From previous experience I will never get a call back. Service here is a joke. CQC need to come as a matter of some urgency.

title: Flu vaccination
body: First class organisation. Well done very fast and efficient flu vaccination. We look forward to our covid vaccination with the same arrangements when it becomes available.

title: Flu vaccination
body: The efficiency of the surgery staff and excellent organisation of the vaccination clinic yesterday was amazing and made the whole process stress free.  Well done Wickham Surgery you are doing a great job!

title: Happy experience
body: Just had a procedure at Tiverton hospital.  First impression was that the hospital was very clean, well organised and covid secure. I had wonderful care in the unit, with a lovely nurse staying with me every step of the way.  Everything went so smoothly, so thank you to everyone for making what could have been a difficult experience into a happy one!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Terrible trying to do anything on websitr
body: Since the merger with another practice it has been a horrible experience trying to do anything online and when you speak to a receptionist they are less than helpful and just try and get you do go online  which is why you contact them as it's not fessable to do online   this has made my expectations with surgery drop  considerably  most disappointing.

title: Best practice ever
body: It is of course invidious to name anyone in this surgery because there is insufficient space so to do.  I have been a patient of this surgery since 1992.  I have absolutely no complaints either with the medical or lay staff.  In fact nothing but praise.  I will single out one aspect.  The Pharmacist.  A very helpful, knowledgeable, charming young man.  (& the lady who preceded him was the same.)  Any problems with your medication ask to speak to them.  I am a drain on the NHS with my meds.  He sorted out my problems on day one & then phoned back as promised to see how I was getting on.  Service with - not just a smile - but with laughter.  Laughter, the best medicine ever.  Well done Avenue House.

title: Flu Jab 24 October
body: The surgery was highly organized and got a large number of older people through the inoculation on a Saturday morning efficiently and with good humour. I was in and out in 7 minutes. I was impressed.

title: Flu vaccination 24-9-2020
body:
My husband and I received our flu  jab this morning.We would like to congratulate all the staff on the safe,efficient and friendly way it was carried out - another reason why we value having a surgery in Berkeley so much.
Thank you. Marlene and David Parry

title: Do not use Failsworth Group Practice if you are…
body:
They will not take bloods for you, even at the request of a respectable private doctor. If questioned, they will tell you to find an - I quote - "more progressive" surgery. 

And their phone lines are terrible.

title: flu injection
body: I am very impressed with the efficient way this was handled, and well done staff, and Thank you, from Joan Allum

title: Good but lacked care and attention
body:
Firstly I appreciate the NHS and Im grateful my dad was able to have a surgery. This hospital in general is good however If It can be safely delayed, I would not recommend having any surgery during the pandemic.  Let me explain.

My dad had a bypass surgery and no visitors are allowed during his stay. We would call him everyday on his mobile to keep in touch. One day I asked him to call over a nurse for a health update. I overheard the nurse say in a rude tone. "Yes! What do you want!". I guess she didn't know he was on the phone. Bearing in mind he has a language barrier, he is weak and can barely speak. This is no way to speak to a patient who just had heart surgery. She didn't even come over to ask if everything is okay. Without family being able to visit the ward. Care provided is questionable. You really dont know how the patient is being treated.

It gets worse. Once I got my dad home and tried to give his medication. I noticed a box of blood thinning clopidogrel tablets were missing. The nurses FORGOT to pack them. This is negligence on the hospitals part. As they should have a procedure to double check everything is supplied and signed off. None of the discharge documents were signed off. Now I have to go back to the hospital the next day to collect his medication which he desperately needs.

For these reasons. I would think twice about having surgery during the pandemic. You dont want all this negligence and stress if your treatment can be safely delayed till family member can attend the hospital and keep staff accountable because clearly from my experience they are not.

title: great organisation for Flu jabs
body: No waiting, 8 or 9 stations available, all complete in a couple of minutes. Friendly staff, obviously all giving up their Saturday.

title: shockingly inadequate practice
body: I contacted the service on the advice of my GP and they carried out an assessment. I was told I would be put on a waiting list for an appropriate therapy. Then all of a sudden, I got a letter informing me that I could not get any treatment and had to fund private treatment myself. I have paid taxes all my life and this is disgusting. I was told I needed treatment but would have to pay for private therapy which I cannot afford. So much for NHS England's promise to put mental health on the same footing as physical health by 2020. I would not be told to fund say diabetes or cancer treatment privately.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great people
body: I came in an ambulance with severe breathing issues and was seen straight away by doctors and nurses. Turns out had pneumonia and other complications which was explained to me during my treatment and is still on going been here a week now. The nurses and doctors on the wards have been friendly and attentive especially with the amount of blood taking and other medication being given to me. But I do have one gripe the food here is just awful, menu repetitive small portions so much so I have resorted to ordering takeaways and because I’m bed bound means ore work for the nurses to go get it from reception, but buy 1 get one free pizza so nurses can have one, I’m not greedy.

title: First class care
body:
Having been admitted last minute after covid complications I can't praise the whole compliment of staff enough for their constant care throughout my stay.
From the porterage at the beginning of my visit to the very thorough cleaning and auxiliaries, the wonderful food and its delivery and presentation.
Obviously not forgetting the nursing staff, what wonderful, kind, considerate and very very caring team you have given the extremely difficult and trying circumstances at the present time.
The consultants and doctors were extremely professional but I wouldn't anything less in any other hospital from doctors and consultants.
Hospital stays are never good but I doubt very much if I could have possibly received any better or more attentive treatment from any other hospital in the country.
Barnsley hospital is something to take pride in.

title: Upsetting and disappointing
body: I have been using Barkentine for ante natal and post natal care. I, thankfully, gave birth at another location. All my care was frighteningly inept to the point where I dreaded going in. They repeatedly lost urine samples, a GTT test (which took four hours to take), gave me the wrong answers to my questions and promised call backs which never happened. Appointments were cancelled without communications, an appointment cancelled the night before my 'birth plan' talk at 38 weeks, and there was limited social distancing in place during Covid's peak which was scary as a shielding pregnant woman. Post natally, I was called to the clinic 5 days after having a C-section because "home visits are not possible". The clinic is a 30 minute taxi from my house and I simply couldn't face this after having major abdominal surgery. My experience with the Barkentine's ineptitude made me genuinely fearful of giving birth. Covid should not be used as an excuse for poor quality of care.

title: Flu jab
body: Very efficient. We were in and out very quickly. Great staff well organised and no complaints. Why do you have to have a. Minimum of 100 characters?

title: Useless
body:
Useless online service. Unable to speak with a doctor.
All phone lines automated and useless.
No option to reach medical advice, no opportunity to receive a help.

title: Bad policy in Musgrove
body: Visit to A&E recently. Rushed in by ambulance. Was unhappy about being discharged at 3am in the middle of night having no phone, money, still feeling unwell. Doctors were good but after the 4 hr target I was discharged at silly o clock without much thought and being unwell didn't think wise to walk the 3 mile trek at night alone.

title: Not good
body: The dr's at this practice have been most unhelpful with their responses. Moved to Northumberland in March and never had face to face consultations but following telephone appointments we have been left very frustrated and definitely unhappy. Fortunately we are leaving the area this week but no way could we recommend this practice. The reception staff do a good job under difficult circumstances but I think the medical staff need some customer relationship refresher training. Without going into details we have found we received negative responses and downright insulting attitudes.  No positivity at all. To say what has been said without ever meeting a patient, never mind one who was a senior member of nursing profession is not good enough.

title: Very poor standard of staff excluding GP
body: How long can this surgery survive when you have a receptionist who along with practice nurse do not even know they are service providers. They bully you,won't listen to you,will lie just to cover up their incompetence. I am writing this review knowing very well from previous posted reviews that sunrise medical have not responded to them. Fat chance I will get anywhere. Hence I am sending in written complain because this sort of behavior is tottally wrong for service provider.I don't want anyone to go through what I had to experience . The frontline staff are dragging the surgery into gutter.I am one of first thirty patient who registered when this surgery opened. Never had any complain. New staff need to learn form long serving staff. I had appointment to have injection on 23rd October 2020. After all the formalities I was asked to hand over the injection which I didn't have and neither did I know that I had to pickup from chemist. The nurse did try and check if that injection was available in the surgery. Negative so she said I will have to rebook my appointment and being helpful looked on the systems and asked if I could attend same day 3pm for the injection. I accepted and went to chemist for injection he didn't get the prescription so he sent his staff to pick up the prescription. Normally my prescription is electronically sent. I  got the injection and arrived at the surgery door 2.58pm. At this point receptionist and the nurse had cup in their hands and making their way upstairs. I asked am I late they replied through locked door the doctor is not here receptionist said he will come at 3.30pm and nurse said he won't be long.I said why didn't you tell me to come at 3.30. What am I going to do. They just walked upstairs. I am insulin dependent diabetic,chronic heart disease. Difficulty standing for long period and am over 70 years of age.I was very worried as I knew by 4pm I would need snack or I will collapse. I went to buy sweets and came back at 3.30pm and the nurse called me for injection. I asked who is giving me the injection she said I am. I said you lied to me that doctor was not there so I will have to wait. Why didn't you give me 3.30 appointment. She went to the doctor and said "I refuse to give him injection as he is rude". I said I am diabetic and had to eat sweet to keep my strenght whilst her attitude was out of line. If you are refusing then I will report this to CQC. She asked me togo for injection and said  I thought you were going to wait in the car.I said I don't have a car. She said surgery was empty you could have waited inside. I said you walked upstairs and I had to go. I said to her check my record she said she didn't want to. She kept trying to call surgery owner GP. As she couldn't she gave me the injection and went on to say I have been in this country for32 years and studied here No one has ever complained.I then said to her I have lived here for 55years and as retired justice won't tolerate incompetence.

title: Utterly useless and made me worse
body: Think Wellbeing in St Helens claims to offer one-to-one and telephone support, but all they did was a triage appointment that they didn't finish as they didn't offer any way of ensuring I could be somewhere where what I said would be confidential so I had to talk over the phone in public, and the call just made me worse while offering no solutions or help unless I'm in crisis. In the current situation, the NHS should be HELPING people before they get to crisis stage, not telling them they can only help if they're in crisis.

readBy.name: North West Boroughs Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Flu vaccination
body: Flu Jab Saturday 24th Oct. The surgery had set up a very efficient speedy and safe environment to have the vaccination. It was very busy with people and thankfully it took no time at all to be vaccinated. Very good and well done. Mr D Andrews.

title: Organised
body: I visited the surgery yesterday for my flu injection. The planning and execution of my visit was excellent. Staff were so friendly and planned the social distancing impeccably. My visit was from start to finish was done in a timely fashion. The best and quickest appointment I’ve ever had here!

title: Cardio-Rehab
body:
Excellent service despite having to be adapted due to Covid 19.
On-line video warm-up exercise well presented & easy to follow, also the programme, following handbook instructions. I never felt pressurised & was pleased to have the weekly 'phone calls to check on my wellbeing & to collect my data.

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: NHS 111 ridiculous service and total waste of time
body:
I call NHS 111 due my both side toothache (right side got tooth abscess and left side tooth just snap and hole. i cant drink or eat because sharp pain. they advised me to call Seven Dental and theyre open 8am and 9pm i did call them but they closed at 8.30pm? i check their review rate were very poor, why NHS 111 advised me go there because i am third class due i am deaf??? I find this disgusting and i want go to the dental with good service as special i am deaf and easy communication. 
NHS 111 direct nurse advised me to call back in the morning 8 am i did I can't believe that you ask me the details again. advised me call seven dental again. they can't help me at all wow I have bad headache, pin tickle pin because of tooth abscess. you do not care just interest to fill in the form thats all. 
i will share this information to Deaf community which you have already signed to approval for the deaf people need access communication (nhs charter) its false hope. 
I will never never call to NHS 111 again and Now I believe the deaf people in UK said NHS 111 nightmare. if there any emergency then i will call 999 instead nhs 111. 
i can't drink or eat another 24 hours you failure to look after me or other people as well. I will never call you again ashamed yourself

title: Heartbroken by lack of care
body:
My 81 yr old mother has terminal cancer and has been treated so carelessly by certain members of staff. She was discharged to come home last Thursday(22/10) but because someone “forgot” to process the paperwork, her last days of life are spent waiting on a ward. She is dreadfully upset and we can’t be with her- we understand that, but this is cruel. She asked for help and was told by a nurse, “ I’m here to monitor not care for you” 
Good Hope is our local hospital, our children have been born there, operations had over the years and we have been happy. However, this experience has been appalling. Covid is no excuse for poor care, compassion or simple kindness. Communication is non existent and when you do get to speak to someone, the information is muddled and incorrect. You wouldn’t want this to happen to anyone. You should hold your heads in shame because I’m ashamed of you.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust
